examples: Scientists developed genetic screening to help families avoid having a child with fatal genetic disorders.

meanings.definition: Beginning of a pregnancy; beginning of an idea.
examples: After conception, a fetus can undergo genetic testing.
The classroom walls show the range of vocabulary words that weâ€™ve learned this year.

images.alt: Photo of an island with mountains.
images.description: Photo showing an island in an ocean. The island has a beach, a desert area, mountains, forests, all in a very small area.
images.caption: This picture shows a range of landforms, including mountains, forest, desert, and the ocean.

meanings.definition: A condition or fact that affects a situation or event.
examples: Depending on their circumstances, parents make different choices about whether or not to proceed with genetic testing.

meanings.definition: To control with rules or laws.
examples: In the United States, the government does not regulate genetic testing; only doctors and their patients make decisions about genetic screening.

images.alt: Round sign with diagonal line across drawings of food.
images.description: Round sign with diagonal line across drawings of French Fries and Ice Cream. The sign means that food is not allowed where this sign is posted.
images.caption: Many businesses regulate whether people can bring in food or drinks. What other regulations do you know about?

meanings.definition: Of or happening in the present time.
examples: Current medical science allows them to choose the sex of their child before conception.

meanings.definition: Of or happening in the present time.
examples: Contemporary medical science allows them to choose the sex of their child before conception.

meanings.definition: A characteristic or quality that makes a person or animal different from others.
examples: Scientists believe people will be able to screen for other traits within the next 10 to 20 years.

images.alt: Photo of a person with brown eyes and freckled face.
images.description: Photo of a person with light skin, brown eyes, and many freckles on her face.
images.caption: Freckles, eye color, and hair color are all genetic traits.

meanings.definition: A characteristic or quality that makes a person or animal different from others.
examples: Scientists believe people will be able to screen for other attributes within the next 10 to 20 years.

images.alt: Photo of a person with brown eyes and freckled face.
images.description: Photo of a person with light skin, brown eyes, and many freckles on her face.
images.caption: Freckles, eye color, and hair color are all genetic traits.

meanings.definition: Continuing from sometime in the past into the present
examples: Science fiction authors have created worlds in which ongoing genetic testing is common.

meanings.definition: Continuing from sometime in the past into the present
examples: Science fiction authors have created worlds in which continual genetic testing is common.

meanings.definition: To say that something is not true; refuse to agree with.
examples: For example, in the movie Gattaca, people with less than-perfect genes were denied good jobs and became a lower class of citizens called 'Invalids.'

images.alt: Photo of woman holding her hand up, with palm toward camera
images.description: A woman holding her hand up with palm toward the camera, doing stop gesture.
images.caption: A woman gesturing 'no' to someone taking her picture.

meanings.definition: To say that something is not true; refuse to agree with.
examples: For example, in the movie Gattaca, people with less than-perfect genes were rejected for good jobs and became a lower class of citizens called 'Invalids.'

images.alt: Photo of woman holding her hand up, with palm toward camera
images.description: A woman holding her hand up with palm toward the camera, doing stop gesture.
images.caption: A woman gesturing 'no' to someone taking her picture.

meanings.definition: A space or opening made by or as if by breaking or separating.
examples: Because genetic screening is very expensive, some people worry that genetic screening will widen the gap between rich and poor.

meanings.definition: A space or opening made by or as if by breaking or separating.
examples: Because genetic screening is very expensive, some people worry that genetic screening will widen the disparity between rich and poor.
